oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Drive on the Hindenburg Line
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Prisoners of War; Guards; Horses; Cavalry; Horse artillery; War destruction & pillage; War damage; War; World War, 1914-1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Germans taken prisoner by the Americans during the drive on the Hindenburg Line at Bellicourt and the Canal St. de Quentin march along a road under guard. The background of the image features buildings which have sustained heavy war damage. Allied troops lead the prisoners of war along the road, but they also litter the route as bystanders of the march. Military vehicles are passing this scene on the opposite side of the street.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Army. Signal Corps

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: War; World War, 1914-1918; Dogs; Military officers; Uniforms; Military personnel; Campaigns & battles
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The caption reads, "Capt. George of "C" Co. and "Fritz." Fritz was captured from the German at Busigny. Besides his three service stripes he has a wound stripe for a gassing. They are standing in front of a fence. Houses are visible behind the fence. Fritz looks like a black, fluffy dog of mixed breeding. He is wearing a coat with his military stripes and he has a collar on with a rope attached to it. His handler, Caption Henry H. George, is holding on to the rope.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: British sending American propaganda to the German soldiers via small balloons
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees, that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military vehicles; Trucks; Balloons; Propaganda; Military personnel; Soldiers; Military uniforms; Uniforms; Helmets; Campaigns & battles; War; Balloon ascensions; Communication devices; War allies; World War, 1914-1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Image features British troops in a field gathered around military trucks containing tanks of inflating gas. American propaganda materials are being suspended from small air balloons that will convey them to German soldiers. In the photo, one balloon is being readied while another is already airborne. A number of British military personnel have congregated around the operation to observe. This image's Signal Corp identification number is SC#28390.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Army. Signal Corps

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: War; Machine guns; Fishing nets; Camouflage (Military science); World War, 1914-1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This machine gun emplacement on the East Poperinghe line is covered in cloth and fish net. They serve as camouflage for the machine gun in order for it to blend into the surrounding area. Caption reads: "Machine Emplacement on East Prop. Line The Fish net; is camouflage."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Warfield, Francis B.

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sandbags; Fortifications; Castles & palaces; Military headquarters; War; Poperinge (Belgium); World War, 1914-1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Caption reads: "Gold Fish Chateau constructed into a Brigade Hdq. By 105 Engrs. Located on Poperinghe-Ypres Road." The Chateau is a three story building, made up mostly of brick. Sandbags, used for fortification, are stacked outside the entrance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Warfield, Francis B.

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: War; World War, 1914-1918; Canals; Barracks; Military camps; Officers' quarters; Mess halls
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This photograph features the "Dead End" of the Ypres Canal in the foreground of the image. Behind it appears the officers' and noncommissioned officers' billets and the mess hall. The caption reads: "All comforts of home. Roulette, Tea and boating in the afternoon."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Warfield, Francis B.
